hotels.name: Explora Lodges
hotels.desc: Immersive all-inclusive lodge experience, two new properties, explorer-focused itineraries
hotels.longDesc: Explora's expansion into Patagonia with two new properties offers deep-dive exploratory experiences in one of the world's most dramatic wilderness destinations.
hotels.address: Torres del Paine National Park, Torres de Paine, Magallanes y la AntÃ¡rtica Chilena, Chile

hotels.name: Palacio del Inka, Hotel
hotels.desc: Historic colonial palace hotel, central plaza location, traditional Peruvian architecture
hotels.longDesc: A beautifully restored colonial palace in the heart of Cusco's historic center, offering families authentic Peruvian charm with modern comfort and easy access to major attractions.
hotels.photoAttribution: Palacio del Inka, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Cusco

hotels.name: Selina Plaza de Armas Cusco
hotels.desc: Boutique hostel hotel, rooftop terrace, social atmosphere, budget-friendly luxury
hotels.longDesc: A vibrant boutique hotel perfect for families seeking community vibes, with a stunning rooftop overlooking the Plaza de Armas and affordable rates without sacrificing comfort.

restaurants.name: Central

restaurants.longDesc: Virgilio MartÃ­nez's acclaimed Lima restaurant has earned multiple accolades as one of the world's best, offering innovative cuisine that draws inspiration from Peru's diverse ingredients and culinary traditions.

restaurants.name: Mil Centro
restaurants.desc: Fine dining in Cusco, chef Luis Valderrama, modern Peruvian cuisine
restaurants.longDesc: A high-end restaurant in Cusco helmed by chef Luis Valderrama, part of Virgilio MartÃ­nez's culinary empire, offering contemporary interpretations of Peruvian gastronomy.
restaurants.photoAttribution: MIL - Food Lab and Interpretation Center

restaurants.longDesc: An acclaimed restaurant celebrating Peru's culinary diversity with inventive dishes that blend traditional ingredients with contemporary techniques, ideal for adventurous family diners.

experiences.name: Cusco
experiences.desc: Historic Incan capital, colonial architecture, cultural gateway to Sacred Valley
experiences.longDesc: The ancient heart of the Incan Empire, Cusco blends pre-Columbian ruins with Spanish colonial architecture, serving as the cultural and historical starting point for journeys to Machu Picchu.

experiences.name: Sacred Valley
experiences.desc: Valley of Incan heritage, terraced villages, mountain scenery, cultural heartland
experiences.longDesc: A stunning Andean valley dotted with Incan archaeological sites, traditional indigenous villages, and spectacular mountain vistas, offering authentic cultural experiences between Cusco and Machu Picchu.

experiences.name: Aguas Calientes
experiences.desc: Gateway town to Machu Picchu, mountain setting, thermal springs, train terminus
experiences.longDesc: A charming mountain town nestled in the Andes that serves as the primary access point for Machu Picchu visits, famous for its thermal hot springs and the terminus of the Hiram Bingham train.

experiences.name: Machu Picchu
experiences.desc: Ancient Incan citadel, mountain sanctuary, UNESCO World Heritage Site, iconic landmark
experiences.longDesc: One of the world's most magnificent archaeological sites, this 15th-century Incan citadel sits high in the Andes Mountains, offering breathtaking views and profound historical significance.

experiences.name: Belmond Hiram Bingham
experiences.desc: Luxury scenic train, four-hour journey, Peruvian cuisine, observation car, iconic rail experience
experiences.longDesc: An opulent train journey through the Peruvian highlands connecting Cusco, the Sacred Valley, and Aguas Calientes, featuring gourmet dining, cocktails, and panoramic open-air viewing cars.

experiences.name: Legendary Expeditions
experiences.desc: Luxury expedition company offering curated Peruvian adventures including Machu Picchu
experiences.longDesc: A premier expedition operator specializing in immersive luxury journeys through Peru's most iconic archaeological and natural destinations.

experiences.name: Arequipa
experiences.desc: Vibrant colonial city, underrated alternative to Machu Picchu, local atmosphere, fewer tourists
experiences.longDesc: Experience Peru's vibrant second city with colonial architecture and authentic local culture. A refreshing alternative to overcrowded Machu Picchu with remarkable street life and heritage.

experiences.name: Patagonia
experiences.desc: Wild luxury deep in wilderness, dramatic mountain landscapes, remote adventure
experiences.longDesc: A remote wilderness destination offering wild luxury experiences amid Patagonia's dramatic peaks, pristine landscapes, and thrilling outdoor adventures.

experiences.name: Centro ArqueolÃ³gico de Chinchero
experiences.desc: Inca ruins, traditional weaving demonstrations, authentic highland village experience
experiences.longDesc: An often-overlooked Inca site in the Sacred Valley where families can explore ancient terraces, watch local artisans weave on traditional looms, and experience genuine Andean culture.
experiences.address: Museo de Sitio de Chinchero, Ruta Santisimo Downhill 2, Chinchero 08651, Peru

experiences.name: Titicaca Travel Peru
experiences.desc: Floating reed islands, Uros people culture, boat tours, unique highland ecosystem
experiences.longDesc: Explore the world's highest navigable lake and visit the extraordinary floating islands of the Uros people, where families can interact with locals and experience a completely unique way of life.
experiences.address: Plaza de Armas, Jr. Puno 501, Puno 21001, Peru

experiences.name: Qorikancha
experiences.desc: Former Inca temple and most important temple in the Inca Empire, now partly Santo Domingo Convent

experiences.name: Machu Picchu HotSprings
experiences.desc: Natural hot spring baths located at the edge of town with mountain views
experiences.address: Avenida Hermanos Ayar, Aguas Calientes 08681, Peru

experiences.name: Traditional Textile Center of Cusco
experiences.desc: Textile museum and shop showcasing traditional Andean weaving techniques and authentic textiles
experiences.photoAttribution: Center for Traditional Textiles of Cusco

kidFriendly.name: Park of the Legends Zoo
kidFriendly.desc: Open-air zoo, Peruvian wildlife, interactive animal encounters, family-friendly facilities
kidFriendly.longDesc: A spacious open-air zoo featuring native Peruvian animals like jaguars, pumas, and Andean condors, with engaging exhibits and activities perfect for young children to learn about regional biodiversity.
kidFriendly.address: Av. Parque de las Leyendas 580, San Miguel 15088, Peru

markets.name: Municipal Market of San Isidro
markets.desc: Upscale food market, fresh produce, artisan goods, local delicacies, cooking classes
markets.longDesc: A vibrant gourmet market in Lima's upscale neighborhood showcasing Peru's finest ingredients, local crafts, and food vendors where families can sample regional specialties and shop for souvenirs.
markets.address: Av. Augusto PÃ©rez AranÃ­bar, San Isidro 15076, Peru

a.name: Peru's Gentle Magic: Lima, Sacred Valley & Machu Picchu (9 Days)
a.description: A family-paced journey through Peru's most enchanting landscapes, from coastal Lima to Andean villages and the wonder of Machu Picchu, designed for little explorers.
